first_reading.text:
[[1_R 3,5]]The LORD appeared to Solomon in a dream at night. God said, "Ask something of me and I will give it to you."
[[1_R 3,7]]O LORD, my God, you have made me, your servant, king to succeed my father David; but I am a mere youth, not knowing at all how to act.
[[1_R 3,8]]I serve you in the midst of the people whom you have chosen, a people so vast that it cannot be numbered or counted.
[[1_R 3,9]]Give your servant, therefore, an understanding heart to judge your people and to distinguish right from wrong. For who is able to govern this vast people of yours?"
[[1_R 3,10]]The LORD was pleased that Solomon made this request.
[[1_R 3,11]]So God said to him: "Because you have asked for this--not for a long life for yourself, nor for riches, nor for the life of your enemies, but for understanding so that you may know what is right--
[[1_R 3,12]]I do as you requested. I give you a heart so wise and understanding that there has never been anyone like you up to now, and after you there will come no one to equal you.
first_reading.title: 1st book of Kings

psalm.text:
[[Ps 119,57]]I have said to the LORD, that my part; 
is to keep your words.
[[Ps 119,72]]The law of your mouth is to me more precious 
than thousands of gold and silver pieces.

[[Ps 119,76]]Let your kindness comfort me 
in accord with your promise to your servant.
[[Ps 119,77]]Let your compassion come to me that I may live, 
for your law is my delight.

[[Ps 119,127]]For I love your commands 
more than the finest gold.
[[Ps 119,128]]For in all your precepts I go forward; 
every false way I hate.

[[Ps 119,129]]Wonderful are your decrees;
therefore I observe them.
[[Ps 119,130]]The revelation of your words sheds light,
giving understanding to the simple.
psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.text:
[[Mt 13,44]]Jesus said to his disciples: â€œThe Kingdom of heaven is like a treasure buried in a field, which a person finds and hides again, and out of joy goes and sells all that he has and buys that field.
[[Mt 13,45]]Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant searching for fine pearls.
[[Mt 13,46]]When he finds a pearl of great price, he goes and sells all that he has and buys it".
[[Mt 13,47]]Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a net thrown into the sea, which collects fish of every kind.
[[Mt 13,48]]When it is full they haul it ashore and sit down to put what is good into buckets. What is bad they throw away.
[[Mt 13,49]]Thus it will be at the end of the age. The angels will go out and separate the wicked from the righteous
[[Mt 13,50]]and throw them into the fiery furnace, where there will be wailing and grinding of teeth.
[[Mt 13,51]]Do you understand all these things? They answered, "Yes."
[[Mt 13,52]]And he replied, "Then every scribe who has been instructed in the kingdom of heaven is like the head of a household who brings from his storeroom both the new and the old."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew

second_reading.text:
[[Rm 8,28]]Brothers and sisters: We know that all things work for good for those who love God, who are called according to his purpose.
[[Rm 8,29]]For those he foreknew he also predestined to be conformed to the image of his Son, so that he might be the firstborn among many brothers.
[[Rm 8,30]]And those he predestined he also called; and those he called he also justified; and those he justified he also glorified.
second_reading.title: Letter to the Romans
